data.meta_description:
DAY 21: KEEPIN’ IT RELEVANT


I swear I’ve said a variation of this message every other day throughout this series but THAT IS BECAUSE IT IS VERY…
data.text:
📌Want to learn English, but don't know where to start? 📌As a non-native English speaker, I know the struggle. Here are some tips for beginners: 1. Start with the basics. - Learn the English alphabet - Memorize common vocabulary - Practice simple grammar rules 2. Immerse yourself in English. - Watch English-language movies - Listen to English-language music - Read English-language books and articles 3. Set achievable goals. - Focus on small, achievable goals - Celebrate your progress - Keep pushing yourself forward 4. Don't be afraid to make mistakes. - We all make mistakes when learning - Learn from your mistakes - Keep practicing 5. Practice, practice, practice. - Practice speaking with native speakers - Take an English course - Use language learning apps like Duolingo or Babbel 📌Learning English may seem daunting, but with consistent practice and a positive mindset, you can do it! Start small, immerse yourself in the language, set achievable goals, and don't be afraid to make mistakes. Remember, practice makes perfect! Join now👇 https://lnkd.in/gRHeixa5 #englishcommunication #englishlanguage #englishfluency #englishmastery #englishtips

Want to boost your English skills but not sure where to start? Ready to turn your English from "eh" to "ah-mazing"? Here are some fun and effective resources to level up your language game: - Duolingo : Turn learning into a game with interactive lessons. - BBC Learning English: Dive into articles, videos, and audio programs, learn their ABCs (that's "American, British, and Canadian" English, of course!). - HelloTalk : Chat with native speakers and practice your speaking skills. Don't forget to tell them you learned it from a talking parrot. - Memrise : Memorize vocabulary with spaced repetition. - FluentU : Learn from real-world videos with personalized lessons. - Quizlet: Master vocabulary and grammar with flashcards and quizzes. - TED-Ed (TED Talks ) : Improve listening skills while exploring fascinating topics. - Grammarly : Polish your writing with grammar and spelling checks. - Speak Confident English : Get speaking practice and pronunciation tips and impress your friends with your newfound "American Idol" accent! - Youtube : Learn from English teachers like it's Netflix! #EnglishMastery

What are the best techniques to learn the English language naturally from watching movies? Join me in the FREE LIVE masterclass on Zoom on 5th December 2023, 8 p.m. CET to find that out. I will share with you the strategy on how to absorb English expressions and improve both your speaking and listening skills in only 90 days. ✨how and where to find English content to listen to with subtitles for free? ✨where online can you listen to the News in English in different time zones? ✨what is the 7-step process of learning English from short movie extracts? ✨How to establish the routine of speaking English every day for 10-15 minutes? 🔅If you are an ambitious adult on at least a pre-intermediate level with little time but still want to make fast progress in English - this masterclass is for you. 🔆If you feel stuck on the same level after studying English for years - this masterclass is for you. 🔆If you want to make significant progress in English in 90 days - this masterclass is for you. 🔆If what you want is natural English native speakers actually speak every day - this masterclass is for you. 🔆If you are tired of traditional conversation classes, courses, and applications - this masterclass is for you. ✍️Feel free to message me privately to learn more about all of that and secure your spot in the FREE MASTERCLASS I will hold on 5th December 2023, 8 p.m. CET. #english #englishlearning #englishlanguage #learnenglish #studyenglish

🚀 English Tips & Tricks Tuesday! 📚✨ Ready to level up your English game? Here are some quick tips and tricks to boost your language skills! 🌐🗣️ 1. Daily Reading Habit 📖 Make reading a habit! Whether it's articles, blogs, or books, daily reading exposes you to new vocabulary and improves comprehension. 2. Vocabulary Power-Up 💡 Learn a new word every day and try to use it in a sentence. Gradually, you'll build a powerful arsenal of words. 3. Speak Aloud 🗣️ Don't be shy! Practice speaking English out loud. It builds fluency and confidence in your spoken English. 4. Grammar Games 🎲 Turn learning into a game! Play grammar quizzes or apps to make improving your grammar skills fun and interactive. 5. Watch English Content 🎥 Switch your favorite shows to English or watch English movies with subtitles. It's an enjoyable way to pick up colloquial expressions. . . #EnglishTips #LanguageLearning #SpeakLikeAPro #LearnEnglish #LanguageHacks #EnglishLanguage

Hey guys!!! really speaking in English is of course fundamental for our life, it is to expose our ideas with clarity and order in front of a native audience, it allows you to improve your skills, you will also reach a point where you will want to watch movies without using subtitles, you will increase your confidence level. An advantage of learning English is that there is a chance to get a good job and have a good education. I recommend that you do not skip the idea of learning this language because it is widely used by people who speak other languages and it allows them to open many doors wherever you are, so do not wait any longer and start practicing and improving your English. #englishforwork #youcan

5 English words you must know to speak English in real life. But did you know almost 97% of people miss out on these crucial words? Learn these 5 words, along with their meanings and examples, and join the top 3% of English learners! Let’s jump right in! —- Are you ready to stand out in conversations? Discover these words now and elevate your English skills! If you liked this content, ♻️ repost this to your network. And follow Teacher Tiffani for more.

🎥📚 Join us in this exciting tutorial video where our expert teacher dives into the meaning and usage of the popular expression "Couldn't Care Less." 🤔💭 Discover the subtle nuances behind this phrase and learn how to incorporate it effectively into your everyday conversations. 🗣️💬 Whether you're an English learner or a language enthusiast, this video will provide valuable insights and examples to enhance your language skills. Don't miss out on this engaging lesson! 🌟📖 Watch now and level up your English expression game! Like, comment, and share with your friends to spread the knowledge. 📢🔁 Let's keep learning and expanding our linguistic horizons together! 🌍🌈 #EnglishExpressions #LanguageLearning #MasteringEnglish #LearnEnglish #LanguageSkills #learningenglish #englishlesson #accraghana

Have you been learning English for years but feel STUCK? Here's 3 things my best students changed to speak English fluently and confidently 🚀👇 1. STOP typing new vocabulary and phrases in apps or on your phone. Write on paper instead! New research proves this to be more effective for language learning and memory retention. Old-school methods sometimes are the best! 🖋️ 2. STOP listening to audio podcasts all the time. Take some time to sit down and watch speakers on screen instead. Pronunciation and articulation involve the physical actions of the mouth. You need to HEAR and SEE the speaker to improve in this area. 👄 3. DON'T assume that daily listening and reading will improve your English speaking skills. If you want to speak English well then you need to actually SPEAK! Speak to yourself as you go about your day in English and record yourself using WhatsApp voice messages. Find a way to speak out loud every day.📣 Change these 3 things to be great at speaking English!😊🇬🇧 Do you do any of these? #speakenglish #englishtips #englishlearning
